measured_by: Overall Anxiety Severity and Impairment Scale (OASIS)
justification: The article states: "general anxiety in the past week, which was measured using the Overall Anxiety Severity and Impairment Scale (OASIS)."

measured_by: Simple gambling task – total number of gambles chosen
justification: "Risk aversion is represented by the total number of gambles chosen" during the gambling task that assessed decision making under risk, loss and ambiguity.

measured_by: Simple gambling task – contrast between condition 4 and condition 1
justification: Loss aversion was operationalised in the task: "loss aversion as the contrast between condition 4 and condition 1."

measured_by: Simple gambling task – contrast between condition 4 and condition 6
justification: The paper notes participants were "ambiguity averse ... as demonstrated by a comparison of conditions 4 (gamble with known sure outcome) and 6 (gamble with ambiguous sure outcome)."

Participants "completed a battery of questions regarding ... virus-related anxiety…" and the authors "initially selected 24 items that measured the constructs of interest and then used factor analysis" to extract this latent factor.
The same 24-item battery included items on "engagement in protective behaviors," which emerged as one of the latent factors after factor analysis.
Factor analysis of the 24-item questionnaire produced a factor reflecting "perceived infection likelihood."
The authors report that among the five emerging factors from the 24-item battery was "perceived infection severity."
